Description: Top-level grouping for Next Generation Science Standards competencies (SEPs CCCs DCIs)
Parent for NGSS Science & Engineering Practices (8).
NGSS SEP 1: Asking questions (science) and defining problems (engineering).
NGSS SEP 2: Developing and using models.
NGSS SEP 3: Planning and carrying out investigations.
NGSS SEP 4: Analyzing and interpreting data.
NGSS SEP 5: Using mathematics and computational thinking.
NGSS SEP 6: Constructing explanations (science) and designing solutions (engineering).
NGSS SEP 7: Engaging in argument from evidence.
NGSS SEP 8: Obtaining evaluating and communicating information.
Parent for NGSS Crosscutting Concepts (7).
NGSS CCC 1: Patterns.
NGSS CCC 2: Cause and effect.
NGSS CCC 3: Scale proportion and quantity.
NGSS CCC 4: Systems and system models.
NGSS CCC 5: Energy and matter.
NGSS CCC 6: Structure and function.
NGSS CCC 7: Stability and change.
Parent for NGSS Disciplinary Core Ideas (PS LS ESS ETS).
Parent for NGSS Physical Science DCIs (PS1–PS4).
NGSS DCI PS1: Matter and its interactions.
NGSS DCI PS2: Motion and stability: forces and interactions.
NGSS DCI PS3: Energy.

Comp Name: Waves & Their Applications in Technologies for Information Transfer
Description: NGSS DCI PS4: Waves and their applications in technologies for information transfer.
Parent for NGSS Life Science DCIs (LS1–LS4).

Comp Name: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures & Processes
Description: NGSS DCI LS1: From molecules to organisms: structures and processes.
NGSS DCI LS2: Ecosystems: interactions energy and dynamics.
NGSS DCI LS3: Heredity: inheritance and variation of traits.
NGSS DCI LS4: Biological evolution: unity and diversity.
Parent for NGSS Earth & Space Science DCIs (ESS1–ESS3).
NGSS DCI ESS1: Earth's place in the universe.
NGSS DCI ESS2: Earth's systems.
NGSS DCI ESS3: Earth and human activity.
Parent for NGSS Engineering/Technology DCIs (ETS1).
NGSS DCI ETS1: Engineering design.
